Task: Redis keys (additions for Phase 4): Asset Routing: `route:{symbol}` read-through cache.
Redis keys (additions for Phase 4): Token Policy: nonce/idempotency for short-lived claims (e.g., `policy:claim:nonce:{address}`) and replay windows.
Redis keys (additions for Phase 4): OnChain Driver: per-wallet nonces `nonce:{chain}:{wallet}` with on-chain reconciliation.
Redis keys (additions for Phase 4): DePIN: job locks/leases/rate limits (e.g., `lease:{job_id}`).
Redis keys (additions for Phase 4): zk-VaR: proving job locks/idempotency (e.g., `zkvar:{job_id}`).

On-chain strategy (ReFIN L2): All DePIN contracts (NodeRegistry, Staking, QoSOracle, Rewards, Slashing) and optional registries (PolicyRegistry, AttestationRegistry) deploy to the same L2 as the Phase-3 AuditRegistry.
Proving system: zk-VaR circuits use a PLONK/Halo2-family prover; circuits/keys managed per registry.
Egress allow-list (updates): Add RPC endpoints for any new on-chain venues/L2s used by the OnChain Driver.
GPU availability: For offloaded proving/training/inference, either route via DePIN or enable GPU-capable runners for zk-VaR/Trainer/Inference Worker; keep GPU toggles configurable.
GCS buckets (updates): zk-VaR: proofs + PK/VK + circuit metadata.
GCS buckets (updates): DePIN: job payloads and result artifacts (datasets, models, proofs).
Create Phase-4 collections: Routing & Policy: `AssetRouting`, `TokenPolicies`, `PolicyClaims`.
Create Phase-4 collections: zk-VaR: `ZkVarRequests`, `ZkVarAttestations`, `ZkVarCircuitRegistry`.
Create Phase-4 collections: DePIN: `DePINJobs`, `DePINResults`, `QoSJobFacts`, `QoSScores`, `NodeMirror`, `RewardLedger`, `PenaltyLedger`.
Key indexes: `AssetRouting`: PK on `symbol`.
Key indexes: `TokenPolicies`: composite PK on `{token_address, chainId}`; `PolicyClaims`: TTL on `expiry`.
Key indexes: `ZkVarAttestations`: PK `attestation_id`; secondary on `{account_id, snapshot_id}`.
Key indexes: `DePINJobs`: index `{status, created_at}`; `QoSScores`: `{node_id, epoch_id}` composite.
Service accounts (new): `sa-asset-routing`, `sa-token-policy`, `sa-onchain-driver-worker`, `sa-zk-var-attestation`, `sa-depin-gateway`, `sa-qos-oracle`.
Least-privilege roles: Scope each SA to its secrets and collections only.
Least-privilege roles: Allow Execution Gateway to invoke Asset Routing and Compliance Adapter during driver selection and policy checks.
Least-privilege roles: Allow OnChain Driver worker to call Token Policy Module and Compliance Adapter.
Secrets in Secret Manager: On-chain keys: Driver submitter wallet; Token Policy attester_key; QoS Oracle writer key.
Secrets in Secret Manager: RPC credentials: For all new venues/L2s.
No new topics: OnChain path: `orders.cmd` / `orders.evt` (driver=onchain) + `audit.evt`.
No new topics: zk-VaR: in=`risk.approved`, out=`audit.evt`.
No new topics: DePIN/QoS: audit references for settlements flow to `audit.evt`.
Repository: Add service dirs: `asset-routing/`, `token-policy/`, `onchain-driver/`, `zkvar-attest/`, `depin-gateway/`, `qos-oracle/`.
Smart contracts: Add dirs for DePIN and optional PolicyRegistry/AttestationRegistry; wire deploys to ReFIN L2.
Pipelines (updates): Build/deploy new services.
Pipelines (updates): Compile zk circuits; manage PK/VK artifacts in GCS.
Runtime config: Asset Routing decision defaults and cache TTLs.
Runtime config: Token Policy claim TTL, ACE freshness triggers.
Runtime config: OnChain Driver gas/MEV caps, nonce manager, relays.
Runtime config: DePIN dispatch/pricing/QoS windows.
Dashboards (updates): On-chain execution: plan build time, submit→mined latency, revert rate, gas/fee metrics, relay hit-rate.
Dashboards (updates): DePIN: job queue depth, acceptance %, proof/model validation success, QoS score distribution, rewards/slashing volumes.
Dashboards (updates): zk-VaR: proofs/hour, p95 prove time, verify success.
Alerts (new): High revert rate for OnChain Driver; receipt timeouts.
Alerts (new): zk-VaR proof failures/backlog age.
Alerts (new): DePIN stale queue or low node participation/QoS breaches.
Phase-4 SLO baselines: Routing/Policy reads p95 ≤ 50 ms.
Phase-4 SLO baselines: On-chain plan build+sign p95 ≤ 500 ms (pre-submit).
Phase-4 SLO baselines: zk-VaR proof generation (offline) p95 ≤ 10 min.
Contracts deployed: DePIN suite (NodeRegistry, Staking, QoSOracle, Rewards, Slashing); optional Policy/Attestation registries.
Roles granted: QoS Oracle writer wallet has submitter role on QoSOracle.
Initial data: Seed `AssetRouting` and `TokenPolicies` for test assets/tokens.
Secrets: Token Policy attester_key present; claim TTLs configured.
Integration: Gateway calls Asset Routing during driver selection; if on-chain & policy requires fresh ACE, call Compliance Adapter before building plan.
Secrets: Submitter wallet key loaded; relays/RPC configured.
Config: gas/MEV caps; nonce manager; `OrderIdMap` enablement.
Circuits: compile; generate/store PK/VK in GCS; populate `ZkVarCircuitRegistry`.
Runtime: GPU toggles; queue/backoff; Explorer integration endpoints live.
Gateway config: pricing, dispatch policies, QoS formulas/windows.
Node agent: a test provider node enrolled/staked on ReFIN L2 (NodeRegistry/Staking); heartbeat and lease flows verified.
Configure an asset in `AssetRouting` to onchain.
Trigger a trade; verify EG selects the OnChain Driver and persists a plan with `driver="onchain"`.
Driver enforces policy (`need_fresh_ace`), obtains PolicyClaim, signs and submits tx.
Confirm tx mined on L2; `orders.evt` and `audit.evt` reflect lifecycle.
Produce `risk.approved`; service consumes, proves, and writes `ZkVarAttestations`.
Verify audit.evt emitted; Explorer can resolve/verify via read endpoints.
Register and stake a test node on ReFIN L2; `NodeMirror` present.
Publish a small inference/proving job; node accepts lease, returns results; Gateway validates and records QoS.
QoS Oracle writes per-epoch scores; Rewards settlement tx visible on L2; off-chain `RewardLedger`/`PenaltyLedger` mirrors updated.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Read API: Implement `GET /v1/route/{symbol}` (service-to-service, JWT). Return `{route: broker|onchain, driver_hint, params, policy_flags, config_hash}` with a read-through cache (`Redis: route:{symbol}`, short TTL; default route=`broker` on miss).

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Decision engine: Resolve deterministic route using `AssetRouting` + `asset_metadata` with safe fallbacks; derive hints (`slippage_bps`, `mev_protect`, `max_gas_gwei`). If route=`onchain` and token policy requires freshness, include `policy_flags.need_fresh_ace=true`.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Persistence: Create `AssetRouting` collection (PK `symbol`; fields include `route`, `driver_hint`, `token_policy_required`, `token_policy_ref`, `chainId`, `config_hash`, admin metadata).

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Admin (optional for this checkpoint): Upsert via `POST/PUT /v1/route*` with optimistic concurrency using `config_hash` and emit `audit.evt` on change.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Resolve & Issue APIs: `GET /v1/policy/{chainId}/{token}` → `PolicyDecision`.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Resolve & Issue APIs: `POST /v1/claim/issue` → short-lived EIP-712 PolicyClaim when `require_fresh_ace=true`. Persist to `TokenPolicies` and `PolicyClaims` (TTL on `expiry`).

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Freshness path: When policy demands freshness, check `ComplianceCache`; if stale or forced, call Compliance Adapter (which calls ACE) and block unless ALLOW; then mint and sign the claim with `attester_key` (idempotent per `{wallet, token, policy_version}`; Redis nonce to guard replay).

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Claim format: EIP-712 typed data: `{wallet, token, chainId, policy_version, expiry, nonce}`; off-chain verification by the driver; optional on-chain verification via `PolicyRegistry` on ReFIN L2.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Route- & policy-aware verdicts: Extend `/verdict` (internal) to accept hints (e.g., `route=onchain`, `need_fresh_ace=true`). Serve cached verdict for broker path; force fresh ACE when required by token policy; upsert `ComplianceCache` and return `{verdict, reasons, expiry, source}`.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Driver selection: After `risk.approved`, acquire `exec:lock:{account_id}`, load context, call Asset Routing per symbol; if route=`onchain`, set `driver="onchain"` and persist in `ExecutionPlans`. Publish `orders.cmd` with `driver`. SLO: plan build p95 ≤ 500 ms unchanged.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Preflight: For `driver=onchain`, read `policy_flags`. If `need_fresh_ace`, call Token Policy Module to resolve and issue a claim (which internally refreshes via Adapter/ACE). Treat any non-ALLOW as PolicyBlock.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Tx build & nonce/gas: Build venue-specific calldata; manage nonces with `Redis nonce:{chain}:{wallet}` and reconcile with `eth_getTransactionCount`; cap fees; respect `mev_protect` if configured. Pre-compute `txHash` and upsert `OrderIdMap{clientOrderId→txHash}`.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Send & watch: Submit raw tx (RPC or private relay); emit `orders.evt{submitted|mined|reverted}` and corresponding `audit.evt`. Reconcile in Gateway exactly like the brokered path.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — Asset Routing (new Cloud Run service)
Task: Contracts & stores: Use existing `ExecutionPlans`, `Orders`, and (optional) `OrderIdMap`; continue to publish to `orders.evt`/`audit.evt`.
Unit tests (services & mods): Asset Routing decision matrix, cache fallback, policy flag emission.
Unit tests (services & mods): Token Policy: forced-fresh path, EIP-712 signing, TTL/nonce/idempotency.
Unit tests (services & mods): OnChain Driver: tx builder (nonce/gas), claim verification, event emission.
Seed data: Insert a test symbol in `AssetRouting` with `route=onchain` and a `TokenPolicies` row requiring `require_fresh_ace=true`.
Manual trigger: Publish a `risk.approved` for an intent containing the on-chain test asset. Observe Gateway lock and context load.
Gateway & routing verification: Gateway calls Asset Routing and selects onchain.
Gateway & routing verification: `ExecutionPlans` header records `driver="onchain"`.
Gateway & routing verification: An `orders.cmd` with `driver="onchain"` is published.
Policy & adapter path: OnChain Driver calls Token Policy; Token Policy forces fresh ACE via Adapter if needed and returns a PolicyClaim.
Policy & adapter path: Non-ALLOW responses block submission with clear reasons.
On-chain transaction verification: Locate the submitted tx in the L2 block explorer; confirm it executed the expected action (e.g., swap).
On-chain transaction verification: Driver emits `orders.evt{submitted}` then `{mined}` (or `{reverted}` with reason).
Reconciliation & audit: Gateway consumes `orders.evt` and advances `ExecutionPlans`/`Orders` to completed (or terminal error).
Reconciliation & audit: `audit.evt` exists for plan submit and tx lifecycle.
Reconciliation & audit: `OrderIdMap` links `clientOrderId→txHash` for idempotent reconcile.
Idempotency check: Re-publish the same `orders.cmd` (same `clientOrderId`); verify no duplicate writes or double-sends (OrderIdMap/nonce reconciliation).

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — zk-VaR Attestation Service (Cloud Run)
Task: Bus Integration: Subscribe to `risk.approved` (ordered by `account_id`). Publish `audit.evt{kind=zkvar_attestation}` on success. Provide read/verify endpoints for Explorer.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: Deploy & configure: `NodeRegistry`, `Staking`, `QoSOracle`, `Rewards`, `Slashing`, `Treasury`. Grant the QoS Oracle service wallet the authorized role(s) to submit epoch scores and trigger rewards/slashing.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: Contract behaviors: Epoch-gated `QoSOracle.submit`, reward accrual via `Rewards.accrue(node, epoch, score)`, and slashing hooks for hard SLA breaches (e.g., invalid proof).

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: APIs: Job Publishing (internal): create durable `DePINJobs`, price jobs, mint signed work orders (short-lived GCS URLs).

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: APIs: Lease Management (public): eligible nodes poll/accept; exclusive lease tracked in Redis `lease:{job_id}`.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: APIs: Result Submission (public): nodes upload artifacts/proofs to GCS and submit `{hashes, metrics, proof_ref}`.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: Validation: Deterministic checks per job type (training/inference spot-checks, zk proof verification) before accepting results and releasing QoS facts. Persist `DePINResults`. Emit `audit.evt` for accepted results.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: QoS fact generation: Record `QoSJobFacts{job_id,node_id,kind,metrics,…}` for Oracle ingestion; maintain `NodeMirror` for scheduling.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: Persistence & infra: Collections `DePINJobs`, `DePINResults`, `QoSJobFacts`, `NodeMirror`; GCS for artifacts; Redis for leases/locks/idempotency.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: Ingest API: Accept signed QoS facts from Gateway; replay window + dedupe on `{job_id,node_id}`; persist `QoSJobFacts (accepted|rejected)`.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: Per-job scoring: Normalize metrics to `job_score∈[0,1]` and flag SLA breaches (deadline miss, invalid proof).

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: Epoch aggregation: Produce `QoSScores{node_id,epoch_id,score,breakdown}` with guarded idempotency (`REDIS:agg:{epoch_id}`).

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: Penalties & settlement: Evaluate penalties into `PenaltyLedger`; Oracle Writer submits epoch scores on-chain and triggers rewards/slashing; emit `audit.evt` for settlements.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: Enroll & stake: SIWE bind wallet → `NodeRegistry.register` → `Staking.stake`; verify capabilities (GPU/prover). Mirror to `NodeMirror`.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: Lease → execute → submit: Poll `/lease`, receive work order, run containerized workload (prover or GPU train/infer), upload artifacts, submit results + metrics + proof. Periodic healthbeats.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: Workload parity: Training/inference jobs mirror Phase-1 Trainer/Inference Worker artifact formats; zk-VaR proving uses provided witness + pk/vk and returns proof + metrics.

Section: 1) Development & Integration Plan — DePIN Smart Contracts (ReFIN L2)
Task: Offload proving: Replace local prover step with DePIN offload: publish job to Gateway, await `DePINResults`, verify proof, then persist `ZkVarAttestations` and emit `audit.evt`. Job idempotency via `ZkVarRequests` + Redis lock `zkvar:{job_id}` remains unchanged.
Node enrollment & staking: Run the reference agent; perform SIWE, `register`, and `stake`.
Node enrollment & staking: Confirm on-chain state in the L2 explorer and a `NodeMirror` row in MongoDB.
End-to-end job lifecycle (zk-VaR prove): Trigger zk-VaR to publish a proving job → `DePINJobs`.
End-to-end job lifecycle (zk-VaR prove): Agent polls, accepts lease (check Redis `lease:{job_id}`), downloads payload, runs prover, uploads proof to GCS, submits result.
End-to-end job lifecycle (zk-VaR prove): Gateway validates proof and writes `DePINResults` + `QoSJobFacts`.
QoS & settlement: QoS Oracle ingests facts, aggregates epoch scores, and settles on-chain via `QoSOracle.submit` and `Rewards.accrue`.
QoS & settlement: Verify tx receipts in the L2 explorer and reward accrual to the provider wallet.
GPU training/inference path (spot check): Publish a small training/inference job; agent returns artifacts/predictions; Trainer/Inference Worker consume outputs and update `ModelRegistry` / `Signals`.
Audit trail integration: Verify `audit.evt` for accepted results and settlements; Audit Writer persists leaves for Phase-3 batching/roots.
Failure paths: Invalid proof → Gateway rejects, Oracle records breach, on-chain slashing in next epoch.
Failure paths: Lease timeout / duplicate submit → Gateway idempotency prevents double-accept; job re-queued.
